1{-# LANGUAGE ScopedTypeVariables #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | Partial-order scale.
5
6module Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Flat.Applied.PoScale
7  ( PoScale, PoScaleCalc,
8    poScale, poScaleHeight, poScaleDepth,
9    poHeight, poDepth,
10  ) where
11
12import qualified Data.Map                  as Map
13import qualified Data.Set                  as Set
14import qualified Koshucode.Baala.DataPlus  as K
15
16-- | Mapping from element to subelements and scale.
17--   Scale of element is defined by
18--   1 + the maximum scale of subelements.
19--   If elements are cyclic, scales of these elements are -1.
20type PoScale a = Map.Map a ([a], Maybe Int)
21
22-- | Calculate partial-order scale.
23type PoScaleCalc a = [(a, a)] -> [(a, Int)]
24
25-- | Extract partial-order scale.
26poScale :: PoScale a -> [(a, Int)]
27poScale m = K.mapMaybe f $ Map.assocs m where
28    f (x, (_, Just r))  = Just (x, r)
29    f (_, (_, Nothing)) = Nothing
30
31-- | Calculate upward partial-order scale.
32--
33--   >>> poScaleHeight [("a","b"), ("a","c"), ("b","d"), ("c","d")]
34--   [("a",0), ("b",1), ("c",1), ("d",2)]
35--
36poScaleHeight :: (Ord a) => PoScaleCalc a
37poScaleHeight = poScale . poHeight
38
39-- | Calculate downward partial-order scale.
40--
41--   >>> poScaleDepth [("a","b"), ("a","c"), ("b","d"), ("c","d")]
42--   [("a",2), ("b",1), ("c",1), ("d",0)]
43--
44poScaleDepth :: (Ord a) => PoScaleCalc a
45poScaleDepth = poScale . poDepth
46
47-- | Calculate partial-order height.
48poHeight :: (Ord a) => [(a, a)] -> PoScale a
49poHeight = poScaleBy K.gatherToMapSwap
50
51-- | Calculate partial-order depth.
52poDepth :: (Ord a) => [(a, a)] -> PoScale a
53poDepth = poScaleBy K.gatherToMap
54
55poScaleBy :: (Ord a) => ([(a, a)] -> Map.Map a [a]) -> [(a, a)] -> PoScale a
56poScaleBy gather ord = poScaleUpdate m where
57    m       = Map.map v $ gather ord
58    v subs  = (subs, Nothing)
59
60-- | Update partial-order scale for all elements.
61poScaleUpdate :: (Ord a) => K.Map (PoScale a)
62poScaleUpdate m = foldr poScaleUpdate1 m $ Map.keys m
63
64-- | Update partial-order scale for an element.
65poScaleUpdate1 :: forall a. (Ord a) => a -> K.Map (PoScale a)
66poScaleUpdate1 x1 m1 = m2 where
67    m2 = loop Set.empty x1 m1
68
69    loop :: Set.Set a -> a -> K.Map (PoScale a)
70    loop visit x m
71        | Set.member x visit = Map.update neg x m
72        | otherwise = case Map.lookup x m of
73                        Nothing             -> Map.insert x zero m
74                        Just ([], Nothing)  -> Map.update zerof x m
75                        Just (sub, Nothing) -> let visit' = Set.insert x visit
76                                               in scale x sub $ foldr (loop visit') m sub
77                        Just (_,  Just _)   -> m
78
79    zero           = p [] 0
80    zerof _        = Just zero
81    neg  (sub, _)  = Just $ p sub (-1)
82    up r (sub, _)  = Just $ p sub (r + 1)
83    p sub r        = (sub, Just r)
84
85    scale :: a -> [a] -> K.Map (PoScale a)
86    scale x sub m =
87        case get m `mapM` sub of
88          Nothing -> m
89          Just rs | -1 `elem` rs -> Map.update neg x m
90                  | otherwise    -> let ymax = maximum rs
91                                    in Map.update (up ymax) x m
92
93    get :: PoScale a -> a -> Maybe Int
94    get m sub = case Map.lookup sub m of
95                  Just (_, Just r) -> Just r
96                  _                -> Nothing
97
98-- poScale $ poHeight [("a","b"), ("a","c"), ("b","d"), ("c","d")]
99-- poScale $ poDepth [("a","b"), ("a","c"), ("b","d"), ("c","d")]
100-- poScale $ poHeight [("a","b"), ("b","a")]
101
